result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Akeem R Taplin

records.addlTxt: Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Akeem R Taplin in court, in custody.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Akeem R Taplin.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel has filed motion to withdraw.
Statements to the Court by defendant.
Court holds colloquy with defendant as to responsibilities of counsel and counsel's communication with the State.
Court grants motion to withdraw.
Defendant advises Court his family may be retaining counsel.
Court will request that State Public Defender's office evaluate defendant as to eligibility.
Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 28.

Public Defender's office notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
s.s. 971.23(9) Notice Of Intent To Use DNA Evidence At Trial - received

A motion to withdraw has been filed with the court.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Hearing of November 7, 2022 is rescheduled to October 20, 2022 in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Order - granting defendant to review digital discovery

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Akeem R Taplin in court, in custody.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Akeem R Taplin.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel requests defendant be allowed to review discovery while in custody; granted by the Court.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for status.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Motion To Permit Defendant To View Digital Discovery - received

Defendant Akeem R Taplin in court with Attorney Conner Helvig; both appear by video.  Defendant Akeem R Taplin in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Miller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 075764,
Payable Number: 1024686,
Receipt Number: 22RP031723,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring, no contact order.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Akeem R Taplin in court with attorney Conner Helvig.  Defendant Akeem R Taplin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Akeem R Taplin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
   99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAB (DOB 04/17/2005), Timothy P.B.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
